During the electrical storm last night, lightning struck the motor of the Floresville B Street water tower which will impact Floresville High School, Floresville Middle School and Floresville South Elementary. FISD was notified at 8:45 this morning that water to those campuses would only be available for approximately two to three hours. In the interest of safety, we will implement an early release for students at those campuses due to sanitation and drinking water concerns.

If your child is a car rider, we ask that you pick up your child at noon using your normal pick up process.

Buses will begin loading at the following times:

FSE Noon
FHS 12:15 p.m.
FMS 12:30 p.m.

Floresville North Elementary and Floresville Alternative Center will run on their normal schedules.

Meals will be charged based on eligibility (paid, free, or reduced). If students are not in the vehicle, the parent/guardian will be required to provide documentation of student enrollment. At the John Velasquez Baseball Tournament, FISD unveiled a plaque that will hang in the FHS gym in Coach Velasquez‚Äôs honor. John Velasquez‚Äôs wife, Cindy, daughter, Nicole Santos, and grandchildren, Alyssa and Aiden were in attendance to celebrate his legacy with us.

Coach Velasquez grew up in Austin, Texas and attended Travis High School. Velasquez graduated from the University of Texas at Austin. Coach Velasquez came to Floresville in the fall of 1991 and was the Head Baseball Coach for the Tigers for 12 years.

Coach Velasquez holds the record for the most regular season wins for the Tigers and the most playoff appearances. He was instrumental in getting the baseball field back on the high school campus, and started the first Tiger Baseball Tournament in 1996. This annual tournament now bears his name.

Coach V, as he was known, was not only a coach to student-athletes, but also a mentor and true friend. He lived his life for those he cherished. He will always be remembered for his love and dedication to developing young men through the sport of Baseball. #FloresvilleFamily

For the 5th year in a row, the FHS cadets were the top Air Force JROTC team in the Male and Female Masters Division at the 2019 US Open Raiders Championship hosted by NEISD. TX-20012 has fielded male and female teams each of those years so it‚Äôs awesome going toe-to-toe with Army, Navy, and Marine Corps cadets. Our Raiders, led by Cadet Lt Col Faith Gaudlitz and Cadet 1st Lt Jacob Granados, completed all five events of the course that included the Combat Fitness Challenge, Obstacle Course, Cross Country Rescue, Rope Bridge, and 5K run. Additionally, Cadet Master Sergeant Royce Carter ran the 2-mile Ultimate Raider obstacle course with a 25-lb ruck and he was the top Air Force JROTC cadet with a time of 16 min 08 sec. Awesome job!! #TX20012
#FISDGreatKids
